longBusinessSummary: Banpu Public Company Limited engages in the coal mining and power businesses. The company holds an interest in a 1,434 MW coal-fired power plant in Map Ta Phut Industrial Estate, Rayong Province, Thailand. It also manages five coal mines in Kalimantan comprising Indominco, Jorong, Kitadin-Embalut, Trubaindo, and Bharinto, which produce a range of bituminous and sub-bituminous thermal coals in Indonesia. In addition, the company operates the Gaohe underground mine in Shanxi Province and Hebi mine in Henan Province; and operates and manages three combined heat and power plants with a capacity of 248 megawatts and a steam capacity of 808 tonnes per hour in northern China. Further, it owns nine underground and open-pit coal mines, which supplies thermal and coking coal located in the north and the west of New South Wales, Australia. Additionally, it engages in coal exploration and mine development of approximately 15 sites of thermal and coking coal deposits in Mongolia. The company also involved in the power and steam production, purchase, and trading business; provident fund management; solar power generation; logistics; sales and marketing activities; natural gas business; investment in power and renewable energy; and research and development business. It also provides mining, and coal mining and business consultancy services, as well as services to support coal and power business in Vietnam. The company was formerly known as Ban Pu Coal Company Limited and changed its name to Banpu Public Company Limited in July 1993. Banpu Public Company Limited was founded in 1983 and is headquartered in Bangkok, Thailand.
address2: 27th Floor 1550 New Petchburi Road Makkasan, Ratchathewi
